page.title: 03Florence Nightingale
page.content: Florence Nightingale was born on May 12th, 1820 at Florence in Italy. She died in 1910 at the age of 90. Her mother's name was Fanny, her father's William and her sister's Parthenope. In the summer Florence lived at{Lea {Hurst, Holloway, Nr. Matlock, {Derbyshire}where her father paid for the local school. For the rest of the year Florence lived at Embley, near London. Then in 1842 she felt she wanted to help the poor and sick.Her parents did not like this idea though in 1851 she entered a convent hospital in Germany. From here she studied in London. In 1856 a public fund collected Â£50.00 for Florence which she used to set up a Nightingale training school for nurses at Saint Thomas's Hospital.
